results.title: Binning street
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Looks at the range of people, culture, attitudes, traditions and the history that dwells in Binning Street, Erskineville. The program investigates current family life in Australian society in the 1980’s and how it has changed.

results.title: Catch them as they go: religious change in Australia
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross and Argosy Films for Network 0\28
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Looks at young people who, dissatisfied with life have turned to religions such as Hare Krishna, Muslim and the Charismatic Pentecostal Movement.

results.title: Family life
results.creator_credit: Tony Chenn, Ugo Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Fairfield in Sydney is a community of diverse ethnic groups. This program looks at families from three of these groups - Aborigine, Italo-Australian and Anglo-Saxon/Kampuchean. Each family is observed as they discuss how they cope and intend to cope with the cultural differences which surround them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Chenn, Ugo Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: Closing the Gap
results.creator_credit: Glenn Mack, Les Mack and Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria. Raises issues of concern for those attempting to bridge the gap between schools and the local community. Depicts the first tentative steps of a small inner-city secondary school.
Filmed at the historic, heritage registered building on City Road, Southbank, formerly the J.H. Boyd Girls’ High School, now (2017) known as the ‘Boyd Community Hub’.

results.title: Evaluation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Depicts a school that takes its evaluation seriously. Keeping in touch with its community has required constant monitoring and some innovative adjustments. Staff, curriculum, in service and Supplementary Grants meetings are now one and the same and are occasions where parents and teachers learn together.
